result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Judgment of Conviction Ct.6 & Judgment of Dismissal/Acquittal Ct.7: Justin L Johnson

Defendant Justin L Johnson, in custody, and in court with Attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Weil advises the Court the defendant is ready to proceed to plea and sentencing and submits the plea questionaire for review.
Plea of guilty to count 6. State moves to dismiss count 7 but will be read in.
Defendant Justin L. Johnson reads a written statement to the court. 
Court accepts the plea, finds the defendant guilty and renders sentence.
Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
Court grants request to reschedule final status/scheduling conference. Court sets matter with counsel for 5/19 at 3:15 pm.

Defendant Justin L Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Matthew Halverson, sworn & testified. Cross exam. State rests. No defense witness' called. Argument.   Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. State by DA Adam Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco on warrant return before Hon Williams sitting for Branch 2.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify, but matter will be appointed out.  State requesting $5000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $5000 cash bail w/conditions:  not to possess any firearms; no contact with Matthew Brown, Co-Defendant; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Counsel advises defendant requesting preliminary hearing w/in 10 days.  Court orders matter adj to 8/28 at 1:30 pm for preliminary hearing in Branch 2.
